intro: Jacquinia eggersii var. intermedia, commonly known as the Intermediate Jacquinia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heaths and heathers, and is characterized by its compact growth habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or open habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
